Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Please strip the “(revised)” from the git description. This is useful information, but it is better kept in the code review, not in the revision history :).

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment:
The default settings make the new code path trigger by default, and I don’t think that’s a good idea. There are users of computers with less than 10G of free storage (think netbook users for example) who’ll end up with a suddenly red disk indicator after upgrading.

So, I suggest changing the default threshold_type to none.

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: I suggest mentioning threshold_type "none" explicitly to give users a way to disable this feature (and so that you can state the default in the manpage).

Comment: The threshold_type of the battery module doesn’t offer a none type either...
